meanings.definition: A wall or bank of earth or stone built to prevent a river flooding
meanings.sent1: The embankments along the river kept the water from overflowing.
meanings.sent2: The town built sturdy embankments to protect against floods.
meanings.sent3: The playful ducks waddled along the embankments, pretending to be kings of the hill.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the embankments, strong and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The image of the embankments towering over the river stuck in his mind like a stubborn memory.

meanings.definition: A raised bank or wall of earth or stone built to carry a road or railroad
meanings.sent1: The train tracks ran smoothly along the embankments, providing a scenic route.
meanings.sent2: The road curved gracefully around the embankments, offering a picturesque view.
meanings.sent3: The children raced up and down the embankments, pretending they were climbing a mountain.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as solid as the embankments supporting the railway.
meanings.sent5: The embankments guided the path of the road like a gentle hand leading the way.

meanings.definition: A bank or mound of earth raised to support a roadway or railroad track
meanings.sent1: The workers piled up the embankments to provide a stable foundation for the track.
meanings.sent2: The embankments were carefully constructed to ensure the safety of the road above.
meanings.sent3: The embankments seemed to whisper secrets to each other as the train passed by.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to finish the project was as solid as the embankments beneath her feet.
meanings.sent5: The embankments cradled the road like a protective embrace, guiding travelers on their journey.
